title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Naidu lays foundation for Raymond projects worth ₹1,201 cr
items.summary: - *Chandrababu Naidu* virtually laid the foundation stone for three *Raymond Group projects* worth *₹1,201 crore* at the 30th CII Partnership Summit.\n- The three projects include an *apparel manufacturing park* at *Rapthadu* in *Anantapur district* and two units — *JK Maini Global Aerospace Ltd* and *JK Maini Global Precision Ltd*.\n- Through these projects, the Raymond Group is expected to generate about *6,500 direct and indirect jobs*.

items.title: Boeing-787 safety PIL at SC
items.summary:
- *Advocate Prashant Bhushan* cited the Federation of Indian Pilots Association to warn that every passenger in Boeing-787 planes faces grave risk after the Ahmedabad crash.
- The Supreme Court bench said PILs should not become a fight between airlines and asked the civil aviation ministry to respond, clarifying that the AAIB probe will determine causes, not apportion blame.
- Government officials said no blame has been placed on pilots, and a supplementary inquiry would follow only after the AAIB report, with the broader aim of ensuring passenger safety.

items.title: Wheat export ban likely to ease after good harvest
items.author: Jayashree Bhosale, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The Ministry of Consumer Affairs is weighing lifting export restrictions on *wheat products*—**aata**, **maida**, and **suji**—with a cap of 1 million tonnes.
- The *wheat milling industry* is urging easing due to a **bumper harvest** and favorable monsoon, hoping India reclaims global markets.
- Since the 2022 ban, domestic production has improved and some firms already operate overseas; small exports continue under the **Advance Authorisation Scheme**.

items.title: Engimach 2025 in Gandhinagar (Dec 3–7)
items.summary:
- **Engimach 2025** will be held at the *Helipad Exhibition Centre* in *Gandhinagar* from *Dec 3–7*, with over *1,000 exhibitors* from more than *16 countries*.
- It will spotlight **Industry 4.0** solutions, including smart, sensor-enabled machines, **AI-driven systems**, predictive maintenance, integrated logistics, and mass customization.
- It is expected to draw *90,000 visitors* and generate about *₹5,000 crore* in business inquiries.

items.title: IBMA names Avik Roy as President, Gourineni as VP
items.summary:
- IBMA named *Avik Kumar Roy*, CEO & MD of *Exide Industries*, as its new President, and *Harshavardhana Gourineni* as Vice President at the 4th AGM in Kolkata on 12 November 2025.
- The leadership will push *circularity*, sustainable manufacturing and recycling, and stronger public advocacy while benchmarking standards for *Lead-acid* batteries amid the e-mobility and renewable energy shift.
- IBMA also aims to expand membership and strengthen its role as the industry's leading voice across India's energy storage ecosystem.

items.title: Tidco allocates land to 20 companies in Coimbatore
items.author: A Subburaj
items.summary:
- Tidco has allocated **99-year lease** land at *Varapatti* to 20 private companies to establish a *defence industrial park*. 
- It plans to construct **10.5 acres** of buildings to rent to *startups*, boosting defence manufacturing in the region. 
- The move positions *Sulur* as a defence manufacturing hub and ties into plans for an *aerospace and defence park* near *Sulur Air Force Station*.

items.title: ACME Solar VP – Procurement Sengupta steps down
items.summary:
- **ACME Solar**'s Vice President – Procurement, *Sarthak Sengupta*, has resigned citing personal reasons.
- The company said he was relieved from his duties at the close of business hours on **November 14, 2025**, per a stock-exchange filing.
- **ACME Solar** thanked him for his leadership and contributions and wished him success in his future endeavours.

items.title: Production hurdles at JLR drag, yet Tata Motors PV net rises on demerger gains
WPI inflation falls to 27-month low of (-) 1.21% in Oct on GST cut, favourable base
Tata Electronics signs MoU with NIELIT Kohima to skill youth of Nagaland for semiconductor industry
Commercial vehicle manufacturers eye heavy duty demand
items.author: G Balachandar
items.summary:
- The CV sector is expected to log high single-digit growth in H2 FY26, supported by *GST cuts* boosting consumption and utilisation, lifting **M&HCV** demand alongside LCV gains.
- H1 CV volumes were **4.63 lakh**, up **4% YoY**, reflecting a broad pickup across light, medium and heavy segments.
- Executives like Tata Motors and Ashok Leyland see continued momentum, with *lower prices* and *EMIs* driving fleet operators from used trucks to new, feature-rich models, including stronger LCV uptake.

items.title: Govt to ease QCOs for 55 steel grades
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The *steel ministry* plans to suspend 55 *BIS* quality control orders (42 for three years and 13 for one year) to ease sourcing, as recommended by a high-level committee. 
- A notification is expected soon, with 15 more standards referred to an *inter-ministerial group* (IMG) for further deliberations; suspension would allow imports from non-licensed or non-BIS-compliant suppliers for certain grades, per *NITI Aayog*. 
- While defence and *atomic energy* standards are likely to be retained, the move targets grades not domestically produced or in short supply, affecting autos and electrical equipment sectors.

items.title: US ITC considers new Apple Watch import ban
items.summary:
- *The US International Trade Commission* will open a new proceeding to decide if Apple Watches should be banned due to Masimo patents on *blood-oxygen measurement* technology. 
- It will assess whether redesigned watches still infringe these patents, with a target to finish in *six months*. 
- The dispute is part of a broader fight between *Masimo* and *Apple*, involving ITC actions and separate California court cases for large damages.

items.title: Apple ramps up India push as key vendors expand investments, boosts local production
iFOREST launches India's first ESG report for steel sector
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *iFOREST* unveiled India's first ESG performance report for the steel sector along with a **Unified GHG Accounting and MRV Framework** to improve disclosure and attract climate finance.
- The BRSR analysis shows the sector's energy intensity at 23.2 GJ/t and emission intensity at 2.54 tCO2e/t, with renewables under 0.5% and gender representation gaps on boards (**95% male, 18% women**).
- Industry leaders say the framework will attract investment and support India's green steel transition by standardising reporting across Scope 1–3 using India-specific factors.

items.title: How GE Aerospace's Pune facility is powering dreams and precision
Tembo Global: Q2 net profit up 51% to ₹21.9 cr
items.summary:
- Tembo Global Industries posted Q2 FY26 **PAT** of ₹21.9 crore, up 50.5% YoY. 
- Q2 FY26 **revenue** rose to ₹245.4 crore, up 49.8% YoY, with H1 revenue at ₹493.5 crore. 
- EBITDA in Q2 FY26 was ₹33.2 crore, up 125.9% YoY, with a **13.5%** EBITDA margin.

items.title: Man Industries net profit rises 16% to ₹37 crore in Q2 FY26
items.summary:
- *Man Industries* reports *Q2 FY26* net profit of ₹37 crore, up 16% YoY, on consolidated revenue of ₹834 crore.
- EBITDA jumps to ₹102 crore (up from ₹74 crore), with the strongest-ever quarterly *EBITDA* margin.
- Executable order book ~₹4,750 crore and bid pipeline >₹15,000 crore signal strong visibility.

items.title: Hardeep Singh Puri calls for maritime cooperation with Korean shipbuilders
Senvion India, KP sign 2 GW wind projects
items.summary:
- Senvion India and KP Group signed a framework agreement to jointly develop up to *2,000 MW* of wind and wind-solar hybrid projects across multiple states over the next three years.
- KP Group companies — KPI Green Energy, KP Energy and KP Green Engineering — will handle site identification, land, permits, approvals and the full **Balance of Plant (BoP)** scope, while *Senvion India* will supply wind turbine generators under project-specific agreements.
- The deal aims to create a streamlined planning-to-commissioning process by pairing KP Group’s development strengths with Senvion’s Made-in-India turbine platforms for bankable assets.

items.title: SJVN Thermal's 660 MW Buxar unit begins ops
items.summary:
- *SJVN Thermal*'s Unit-1 (**660 MW**) of the 1,320 MW *Buxar Thermal Power Project* in *Bihar* achieved commercial operation.
- The plant runs on *supercritical technology*, with a designed output of **9,828.72 million units/year** and **85%** of supply allocated to *Bihar* under a long-term *Power Purchase Agreement (PPA)*.
- The project is expected to boost power availability in the *eastern region*, with the second **660 MW** unit under implementation.

items.title: Adani Energy Solutions to raise at least $500 mn foreign-currency debt to fund transmission expansion
Adani to invest ₹63,000 crore in Assam power projects
items.summary:
- The Adani Group will invest about **₹63,000 crore** in Assam: **₹48,000 crore** for a 3,200 MW thermal plant and **₹15,000 crore** for two pumped-storage plants (2,700 MW), creating ~**30,000** construction jobs.
- The 3,200 MW plant will use the DBFO model with coal linkage under SHAKTI; commissioning begins Dec 2030 at **₹6.30/kWh**.
- Pumped-storage projects will aid grid stability and renewables integration, boosting Assam’s energy security and planning, with AERC approval and a future PPA with APDCL.

items.title: Shree Refrigerations: H1 net profit falls 81%
items.summary:
- *Shree Refrigerations posts an 81% YoY drop in H1 net profit to ₹1.57 crore,* while revenue remains *largely flat* at about ₹50.39 crore (consolidated) and ₹50.72 crore total.
- *EBITDA for Apr-Sep fell to ₹0.56 crore from ₹1.54 crore year-ago,* with consolidated revenue from operations at ₹50.39 crore, down ~1.1% YoY.
- *Chairman & MD Ravalnath Shende cites HVAC expansion and higher manpower costs as strategic investments expected to drive long-term growth,* as projects progress and revenues recognise.

Silmax opens facility in Bengaluru to boost expansion
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Silmax opens a new manufacturing facility in *Devanahalli*, Bengaluru, with a 10,000 sq ft footprint to bolster its capacity for milling and drilling tools.\n- The plant currently has 5,000 sq ft operational and a monthly output of *4,000–5,000 cutting tools*, improving response times in India and the Asia-Pacific.\n- The company targets *₹100 crore* revenue and plans a training program in *2026* to develop young engineers into toolmakers.

items.title: Voltas Q2 profit drops 76% to ₹32 crore on muted demand
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Voltas's quarterly *PAT* fell 76% YoY to ₹32 crore in Q2 FY26, from ₹133 crore a year earlier.
- Consolidated revenue declined 11% YoY to ₹2,412 crore, with the cooling products segment down 23% to ₹1,215 crore and swinging to a ₹46 crore loss.
- The EMPS segment grew, with revenue up 10% to ₹966 crore and profit up to ₹92 crore, aided by steady execution in projects and anticipated demand pickup after GST changes.
